meanings.definition: A person who hesitates or is indecisive.
meanings.sent1: The hesitaters in the group took a long time to make a decision.
meanings.sent2: The teacher noticed that one of the students was a hesitaters during class discussions.
meanings.sent3: The hesitaters at the restaurant couldn't choose between pizza or pasta for dinner.
meanings.sent4: She was like a hesitaters at a crossroads, unsure which path to take in life.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was known as the hesitaters of the family, always taking her time to decide.

meanings.sent1: He hesitaters before jumping into the pool, unsure of the water's temperature.
meanings.sent2: The team captain noticed some players hesitaters before making crucial plays.
meanings.sent3: The cat hesitaters at the edge of the bed before finally deciding to jump down.
meanings.sent4: The car engine hesitaters before finally starting up with a loud roar.
meanings.sent5: The actor hesitaters before delivering his lines, trying to remember his next cue.
